channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Calls Netanyahu a ‘War Hero’ and Adds: ‘I Guess I Am Too’
item.description: President Trump praised Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel for bombing Iranian nuclear sites, and credited himself as well.

item.title: The exact salary the ultra-wealthy say they’d need to feel ‘comfortable’ in the current climate has been revealed—and it starts at $500,000

item.title: Unregulated Sexual Stimulants Flood West Africa
item.description: Unregulated sexual stimulants claiming to be herbal remedies or pharmaceuticals are flooding the region. Officials are scrambling to address the issue...

item.title: Zach Cherry on ‘Severance’ and His First Emmy Nomination
item.description: The actor’s improv background makes him more comfortable in comedy, but his performance in this twisty sci-fi mystery brought his first Emmy nominatio...

item.title: Trump may want lower interest rates for consumers, but it sure is convenient for the national debt he’s creating, too

item.title: US tech stocks slide after Altman warns of ‘bubble’ in AI and MIT study doubts the hype
item.description: Investors’ long-running enthusiasm for artificial intelligence showed signs of faltering on Tuesday as tech stocks tumbled.

item.title: Texas Republicans Ready to Pass New Redistricting Maps, Just as Trump Wanted

item.title: Trump’s Tactics Mean Many International Students Won’t Make It to Campus
item.description: Students from some countries won’t make it to class this fall because of President Trump’s travel ban. Others can’t get visa appointments. Some are si...

item.title: Gen Z wants to have their AI cake and eat it, too: KPMG intern survey reveals a generation that wants to have things both ways

item.title: Zelenskyy’s speedrun of gratitude—nine thank yous in one minute—shows how foreign leaders talk to Trump
item.description: Zelenskyy avoided the mistakes of February's meeting, where J.D. Vance berated him for not being grateful.

item.title: No Food, No Water, a Broken Leg: How a Hiker Survived a Harrowing Week in the Wild
item.description: Alec Luhn, 38, an American journalist, hopes the lessons he learned from his ordeal in a national park in Norway can help others.
